pros: Staff are very caring, always willing to help out their fellow co-workers.

pros: The hours are good, the staff is friendly, and the benefits are nice

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Gainesville, FL
pros: Room for growth within the company. Great pay and good benefits.
cons: I don't have anything negative to say.

pros: Great benefits and hours. I’ve been here 3 years.
cons: No cons at all. Great place to work

pros: Job is very easy to perform, with the main hurdle being unreasonable expectations on the customer's end due to the nature of the retirement complex. Your duties are broken down into very clear roles each shift and shifts are broken down into 4-hour blocks with a 3-hour break in between. If these kinds of hours work for you this job is incredibly easy and the team you work with is super friendly. Great health benefits.
cons: Management is constantly trying to change the flow of work and will often times make things more difficult for you. Several managers will happily make an example out of you and make you feel on edge even if you're doing everything right. It's usually best to work around them.

review_title: Has potential, it wasn't all bad

pros: You get to meet some of the best people who've worked hard to be where they're at. Some was Doctors, lawyers and served our country. Now living at a retirement home enjoying other successful people
cons: The residents want things their way when cleaning their apartment

review_title: Great place to be a server
pros:
Not as demanding as other serving jobs
Management is extremely flexible and understanding
Since the customers are always the same, you rarely deal with unforseen issues
Coworkers are mostly fun
cons:
Sometimes preferential treatment is given
Customers can be moody/mean
Pay structure is not necessarily based on who does the best job
